poem:
Title: A Lullaby over Distance

Across oceans, Naila rocks 
her child to sleep—
her heart beats with those
in Gaza weeping.

The soft hum of a lullaby 
connects mothers, a rhythmic whisper-
In Manchester, in Gaza,
the same tender shiver.

She clings the child tighter,
imagining a horror not hers,
yet the lullaby carries it, 
a shared murmur of love and terror.
